data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Fallback to the `len` function if `wcswidth` cannot be loaded

Before this commit, simple-term-menu crashed and left the terminal was
in an unusable state if `wcswidth` could not be loaded. Now, `wcswidth`
falls back to the Python `len` function instead. This fixes GitHub issue

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Apply some minor improvements

- Always consider `None` as an empty menu entry
- Consider empty strings as empty menu items if `skip_empty_entries` is
  set to `True`
- Do not require preview functions to accept a `None` value
- Replace `Union[None, x]` with `Optional[x]`
- Sort constructor parameters and cli switches
- Update the documentation of command line switches

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Fix the Python 3.5 compatibility

In Python 3.5, a trailing comma after a keyword-only parameter list
definition is not allowed. This commit removes that comma and
reconfigures black to use a code style which is compatible with Python
3.5.

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Add a GitHub action for running pre-commit checks

This commit adds a GitHub action for running pre-commit checks on pushes
and pull requests. The pre-commit configuration is also changed to run a
scheme validation on GitHub workflow and GitLab CI configuration files.

data.author: karastift
data.message:
An addition to the code example in README.md

It now prints the selected option to the screen.

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Replace `mdl` with `markdownlint`

`markdownlint` is based on `mdl`, has a broader set of rules and is
implemented with NodeJS instead of Ruby which makes it easier to install
`markdownlint` as a pre-commit hook.

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Add the pre-commit framework for automatic checks

This commit adds the pre-commit framework to run automatic checks before
Git commits and in CI runs. Run `make git-hooks-install` to setup the
hooks.

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Allow text modifications

This commit add the `TerminalMenu` constructor parameters
`show_multi_select_hint_text` and `show_search_hint_text` to modify
shown text lines.

This commit fixes GitHub issue #26.

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Add an extra multi-select column

This commit adds an additional multi-select column to the main cursor
cannot longer hide a selected item. This commit also changes the default
multi_select cursor to `[*] ` (ncurses style) and allows to style
brackets differently from the rest of the cursor.

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message: Rename `shortcut_parentheses` to `shortcut_brackets`

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message: Avoid flicker when drawing the cursor column

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Add better support for multi-selection in active searches

This commit adds support for multiple multi-select keys (now `space` and
`tab` by default), so `tab` can be used during an active search to
toggle a selected item. Selection are no longer cleared when the search
is changed. This commit also fixes an UI bug which always marked
selected items on their non-filtered position.

This partly fixes GitHub issue #25.

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Only allow printable characters in search mode

This commit partly fixes GitHub issue #25.

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Refactor command line arguments

This commit reworks the command line interface of simple_term_menu:

- Only keep the most important short parameters
- Use `-` instead of `_` consistently to separate words
- Sort command line arguments (for their destination variable)

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Only allow keyword-only arguments (except for menu entries)

This commit makes all `TerminalMenu` arguments keyword-only (except for
menu entries) to make arguments position independent. This makes adding
new arguments easier in future releases.

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message: Merge branch 'develop'

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message: Add a `show_multi_select_hint` option

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Use `*` as multi-select cursor

`*` can be easier distinguished from `>` especially for color blind
people.

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Always reset the chosen accept key when `show` is called

If a user called `show` twice and aborted the second menu, the chosen
accept key was not reset to `None`.

data.author: Ingo Meyer
data.message:
Make simple-term-menu more robust against Unicode errors

Users who use the `C` or `ASCII` locale could experience Unicode decode
errors with UTF-8 formatted preview files (and UTF-8 output in the
preview window in general). This commit replaces characters which cennot
be decoded with a replacement character instead of throwing exceptions.

data.message:
Support zero and double width characters (only tested on Linux yet)

libc `wcswidth` function can compute the needed columns for a given
unicode string.

data.author: Ingo Heimbach
data.message:
Handle terminal resizing better

- `simple-term-menu` now reacts to `SIGWINCH` to repaint the menu
  immediately when the terminal size changes.
- Menu entries now occupy the complete terminal width (by printing
  spaces) to clear artifacts left from terminal resizing.

data.author: Ingo Heimbach
data.message: Add a preview example for the cli tool to the `README.md` file

data.author: Ingo Heimbach
data.message: Merge branch 'develop'

data.author: Ingo Heimbach
data.message: Increase the version number to v0.6.0

data.author: Ingo Heimbach
data.message: Mention `bullet` in the READMAE as an alternative Python package

data.author: Ingo Heimbach
data.message: Raise a `NotImplementedError` on unsupported platforms (e.g. Windows)

data.author: Ingo Heimbach
data.message:
Add a preview feature

Menu entries can now be previewed with an optional preview window. For
this, the menu entry (or an alternative) text is passed to a given
command or Python callable and the result is displayed as preview
output.

data.author: Ingo Heimbach
data.message: Merge branch 'develop'

data.author: Ingo Heimbach

data.message: Add missing type annotations (and assertions for Mypy)

data.author: Ingo Heimbach
data.message: Truncate menu entries and the title if the not columns are available

data.author: Ingo Heimbach
data.message:
Add a viewport to handle large menus

`simple-term-menu` was broken when the terminal had not enough lines to
show all menu entries. This commit adds a viewport to handle large
menus. The viewport is updated with each cursor movements and scrolls
automatically to keep the cursor visible.

data.author: Ingo Heimbach
data.message:
Remove `requirements.txt` to avoid confusion

By convention, `requirements.txt` is used to describe concrete Python
environments, but in this project the file was used to describe package
dependencies. Thus, remove `requirements.txt` and declare dependencies
in the `setup.py` script directly.
